articles.headline: Online Game, Made in U.S., Seizes the Globe
articles.snippet: World of Warcraft, with almost seven million paying subscribers, has become the first truly global video-game hit since Pac-Man in the early 80’s.
articles.abstract: World of Warcraft, with almost seven million paying subscribers, has become the first truly global video-game hit since Pac-Man in the early 80’s.

articles.headline: Leaving Behind the Torn-Jeans Look
articles.snippet: A new clothing chain from American Eagle Outfitters, called Martin & Osa, will cater to the 25-to-40 consumer.
articles.abstract: A new clothing chain from American Eagle Outfitters, called Martin & Osa, will cater to the 25-to-40 consumer.
articles.lead_paragraph: McLEAN, Va. — Fifteen years ago, as the head of men’s and women’s fashion at Abercrombie & Fitch, the husband and wife team Michele and Charles Martin decreed a new dress code for American teenagers, filled with baggy cargo pants, weather-beaten rugby jerseys and frayed, athletic T-shirts.

articles.headline: Drug Piracy: A Wave of Counterfeit Medicines Washes Over Russia
articles.snippet: Counterfeit prescription drugs are proliferating in Russia and elsewhere, according to the industry and the Food and Drug Administration.
articles.abstract: Counterfeit prescription drugs are proliferating in Russia and elsewhere, according to the industry and the Food and Drug Administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Sept. 4 — Time and again, Dr. Boris A. Merkeshkin pricked his patients’ arms with a needle and injected a drug intended to ease cardiovascular ailments. He did it for six months earlier this year and his patients recovered smoothly.

articles.headline: An Afghan Symbol for Change, Then Failure
articles.snippet: Lashkar Gah is today the epicenter of a Taliban resurgence and an explosion in drug cultivation.
articles.abstract: Lashkar Gah is today the epicenter of a Taliban resurgence and an explosion in drug cultivation.
articles.lead_paragraph: LASHKAR GAH, Afghanistan — It began last summer.

articles.headline: Kenya Killings Put Aristocrat in Racial Fire
articles.snippet: The scion of an upper-crust British family is in a Kenya prison after killing two black Kenyans in little more than a year.
articles.abstract: The scion of an upper-crust British family is in a Kenya prison after killing two black Kenyans in little more than a year.
articles.lead_paragraph: SOYSAMBU, Kenya — Of all the upper-crust British families who came to this country and never left, one is more famous than them all: the Delameres.

articles.headline: Trial Begins for an Icon in Japan
articles.snippet: Takafumi Horie, the brash Internet entrepreneur, pleaded not guilty to charges of violating securities law on Monday.
articles.abstract: Takafumi Horie, the brash Internet entrepreneur, pleaded not guilty to charges of violating securities law on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO, Sept. 4 — Takafumi Horie, the brash, 33-year-old Internet entrepreneur whose rise and fall has captivated Japan the last two years, pleaded not guilty to charges of violating securities law at the opening of his trial here on Monday.

articles.headline: U.S. Opposes Bankruptcy Bonus Plan
articles.snippet: The Justice Department is opposing a proposed pay system for top executives of the Dana Corporation, which is in bankruptcy protection.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department is opposing a proposed pay system for top executives of the Dana Corporation, which is in bankruptcy protection.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department has joined with unions and creditors of the Dana Corporation, an auto parts company in bankruptcy protection, in opposing a proposed pay system for top executives of the company.

articles.headline: Kenya Killings Put Aristocrat in Racial Fire
articles.snippet: Of all the upper-crust British families who came to this country and never left, one is more famous than them all: the Delameres.     They had the most glamorous parties, the most fabled pedigree (going back to William the Conqueror, they said) an...
articles.abstract: Of all the upper-crust British families who came to this country and never left, one is more famous than them all: the Delameres.     They had the most glamorous parties, the most fabled pedigree (going back to William the Conqueror, they said) and, not insignificantly, the most stunning land.
articles.lead_paragraph: SOYSAMBU, Kenya - Of all the upper-crust British families who came to this country and never left, one is more famous than them all: the Delameres.

articles.headline: Leaving Behind the Torn-Jeans Look
articles.snippet: Fifteen years ago, as the head of men's and women's fashion at Abercrombie & Fitch, the husband and wife team Michele and Charles Martin decreed a new dress code for American teenagers, filled with baggy cargo pants, weather-beaten rugby jerseys a...
articles.abstract: Fifteen years ago, as the head of men's and women's fashion at Abercrombie & Fitch, the husband and wife team Michele and Charles Martin decreed a new dress code for American teenagers, filled with baggy cargo pants, weather-beaten rugby jerseys and frayed, athletic T-shirts.      Today, however, the Martins have a very different mission: to wean 30-year-olds off those clothes.
articles.lead_paragraph: McLEAN, Va. - Fifteen years ago, as the head of men's and women's fashion at Abercrombie & Fitch, the husband and wife team Michele and Charles Martin decreed a new dress code for American teenagers, filled with baggy cargo pants, weather-beaten rugby jerseys and frayed, athletic T-shirts.

articles.headline: Trial Begins for an Icon in Japan
articles.snippet: Takafumi Horie, the brash, 33-year-old Internet entrepreneur whose rise and fall has captivated Japan the last two years, pleaded not guilty to charges of violating securities law at the opening of his trial here on Monday.     Mr. Horie's appeara...
articles.abstract: Takafumi Horie, the brash, 33-year-old Internet entrepreneur whose rise and fall has captivated Japan the last two years, pleaded not guilty to charges of violating securities law at the opening of his trial here on Monday.     Mr. Horie's appearance in the Tokyo District Court attracted the same kind of intense interest that the O. J. Simpson trial drew in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO, Sept. 4 - Takafumi Horie, the brash, 33-year-old Internet entrepreneur whose rise and fall has captivated Japan the last two years, pleaded not guilty to charges of violating securities law at the opening of his trial here on Monday.

articles.headline: An Afghan Symbol for Change, Then Failure
articles.snippet: It began last summer.      On a July morning, Taliban gunmen shot dead the province's most powerful cleric as he walked to the main city mosque to lead morning prayers. Five months later, they executed a teacher at a nearby village school as stude...
articles.abstract: It began last summer.      On a July morning, Taliban gunmen shot dead the province's most powerful cleric as he walked to the main city mosque to lead morning prayers. Five months later, they executed a teacher at a nearby village school as students watched. The following month, they walked into another mosque and gunned down an Afghan engineer working for a foreign aid group, shooting him in the back as he pressed his forehead to the ground and supplicated to God.
articles.lead_paragraph: LASHKAR GAH, Afghanistan - It began last summer.

articles.headline: Drug Piracy: A Wave of Counterfeit Medicines Washes Over Russia
articles.snippet: Time and again, Dr. Boris A. Merkeshkin pricked his patients' arms with a needle and injected a drug intended to ease cardiovascular ailments. He did it for six months earlier this year and his patients recovered smoothly.      They may not be so ...
articles.abstract: Time and again, Dr. Boris A. Merkeshkin pricked his patients' arms with a needle and injected a drug intended to ease cardiovascular ailments. He did it for six months earlier this year and his patients recovered smoothly.      They may not be so lucky next time. Dr. Merkeshkin, the chief physician at a large research hospital in Siberia, and his colleagues had unknowingly administered roughly 3,000 doses of fake Cavinton. The drug, made in its genuine form by Gedeon Richter of Hungary, is one of the more common counterfeit pharmaceuticals circulating in Russia, according to the police.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Sept. 4 - Time and again, Dr. Boris A. Merkeshkin pricked his patients' arms with a needle and injected a drug intended to ease cardiovascular ailments. He did it for six months earlier this year and his patients recovered smoothly.

articles.headline: U.S. Opposes Bankruptcy Bonus Plan
articles.snippet: The Justice Department has joined with unions and creditors of the Dana Corporation, an auto parts company in bankruptcy protection, in opposing a proposed pay system for top executives of the company.     The move sets the stage for what could be...
articles.abstract: The Justice Department has joined with unions and creditors of the Dana Corporation, an auto parts company in bankruptcy protection, in opposing a proposed pay system for top executives of the company.     The move sets the stage for what could become the first major test of a new provision in the bankruptcy law aimed at curbing large retention bonuses for top management.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department has joined with unions and creditors of the Dana Corporation, an auto parts company in bankruptcy protection, in opposing a proposed pay system for top executives of the company.

articles.headline: Online Game, Made in U.S., Seizes the Globe
articles.snippet: At 10:43 p.m. one recent Saturday, in a smoky basement gaming parlor under a bank in this sprawling city's expensive Daechi neighborhood, Yoon Chang Joon, a 25-year-old orc hunter known online as Prodigy, led his troops into battle. ''Move, move!'...
articles.abstract: At 10:43 p.m. one recent Saturday, in a smoky basement gaming parlor under a bank in this sprawling city's expensive Daechi neighborhood, Yoon Chang Joon, a 25-year-old orc hunter known online as Prodigy, led his troops into battle. ''Move, move!'' he barked into a microphone around his neck as a strike team of some 40 people seated at computer terminals tapped at keyboards and stormed the refuge of the evil plague lord Heigan, fingers flying.      As Mr. Yoon's orders echoed from speakers around the room, Heigan reeled under an onslaught of spells and swords. In six minutes he lay dead. The online gaming guild called the Chosen had taken another step in World of Warcraft, the online fantasy game whose virtual, three-dimensional environment has become a global entertainment phenomenon among the cybersavvy and one of the most successful video games ever made.

articles.headline: Republican Backs His Stand on Iraq by Deploying
articles.snippet: Jonathan L. Paton is preparing to go to war in Iraq.     Mr. Paton has told his 77-year-old father, in a telephone conversation punctuated with sobs and pauses, how he wishes to be buried, if it comes to that.
articles.abstract: Jonathan L. Paton is preparing to go to war in Iraq.     Mr. Paton has told his 77-year-old father, in a telephone conversation punctuated with sobs and pauses, how he wishes to be buried, if it comes to that.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUCSON, Aug. 31 - Jonathan L. Paton is preparing to go to war in Iraq.
